contextId.information: "'Then Yahweh said, "Now rise up ... Zered.' So." This can be translated as an indirect quote. AT: "Then Yahweh told us to rise up ... Zered. So" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

This has a quotation within a quotation. A direct quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "I command you to open your hand ... in your land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]]) (See:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: I command you and say, 'You must surely open your hand ... in your land.'

contextId.information: This can be translated as a direct quote. AT: "I said, 'I will ... away, and I will ... mankind'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: I said that I would ... away, that I would ... mankind

contextId.information: If this direct quotation would not work well in your language, you may change it to an indirect quotation. AT: "he will tell you to destroy them!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
